edge: In 1913, Hughes' mother teaches him how to spell 'quarantine' and warns him about a cholera outbreak.
In 1927, Hughes begins directing 'Hell's Angels'.
Hughes becomes romantically involved with actress Katharine Hepburn.
Hughes' OCD symptoms are eased by his romantic involvement with Katharine Hepburn.
Hughes' germaphobia is eased by his romantic involvement with Katharine Hepburn.
After the release of 'The Jazz Singer', Hughes becomes obsessed with shooting his film realistically.
In 1935, Hughes test flies the H-1 Racer and pushes it to a new speed record.
Hughes purchases majority interest in Transcontinental & Western Air (TWA).
founder and chairman of Pan Am, Juan Trippe, gets his crony Senator Ralph Owen Brewster to introduce the Community Airline Bill, which would give Pan Am exclusivity on international air travel.
bribes a reporter to keep reports about Hepburn and married Tracy out of the press
leaves Hughes for fellow actor Spencer Tracy
finds a new love interest with 15-year-old Faith Domergue
later has feelings for actress Ava Gardner
takes XF-11 reconnaissance aircraft for a test flight and crashes in Beverly Hills due to one of the engines failing midflight
orders Dietrich to mortgage TWA assets so he can continue developing H-4 Hercules with his own money
paranoid behavior, planting microphones and tapping phone lines due to worsening OCD
search for incriminating evidence of war profiteering
offer to drop charges if Hughes sells TWA to Trippe
refusal of offer
extreme isolation in a germ-free zone for three months
summons Hughes, certain that he will not show up
preparation for Senate hearing by personally grooming and dressing him
accusations of taking bribes from Trippe during Senate investigation
discussion about a new jetliner for TWA
panic attack and flashbacks in restroom during discussion with Dietrich
